> In my experience, in case of (for example) a NullPointerException,
> tearDown() is not (always) called (junit 3.8.1, no extensions).

tearDown is:

- always called in the TestCase
- never called in the junit.extensions.TestSetup
BUT
- always called in the junitx.extensions.TestSetup (JUnit-addons library)

-Vladimir
